data.title: ‘Kingdom Of The Planet Of The Apes’ Is Finally Streaming—How To Watch The Entire Franchise
meta_keywords: Kingdom Of The Planet Of The Apes
data.meta_description: "Kingdom Of The Planet Of The Apes" officially made its streaming debut on Hulu. Here's how to watch the blockbuster film and the other movies in the franchise at home.
data.text:
Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes officially landed on Hulu on August 2, joining the other nine films in the Planet of the Apes franchise. If you’re planning to have a movie marathon, discover how to watch Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes from the comfort of your home below.

The sequel is the fourth installment in the Planet of the Apes reboot franchise and follows 2017’s War for the Planet of the Apes. Set several generations after Caesar’s reign, it depicts a future where apes have become the dominant species while humans live in the shadows. “As a new tyrannical ape leader builds his empire, one young ape undertakes a harrowing journey that will cause him to question all that he has known about the past and to make choices that will define a future for apes and humans alike,” the official synopsis reads.

Director Wes Ball admitted to The Wrap that he initially wasn’t sure how to approach creating Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes. “I had this skepticism of how you follow up that last trilogy,” he explained. “You need to have that distance so you’re not just constantly compared or tethered to that trilogy. Having that time jump was a big opening to me.”

ForbesReview: 'Kingdom Of The Planet Of The Apes' Delivers A Glorious New Chapter

The director had the idea to focus the story on a young chimpanzee named Noa, who teams up with a human woman named Mae to shape the future for both apes and humans. “Mae would be this puzzle that you sort of have to unwrap a little bit as the story goes,” Ball continued. “It was just a matter of degrees on how capable or uncapable she was.”

Ball added that he also knew who the villain in the sequel would be early on. “Pretty quickly I had this character idea of a Genghis Khan-type that was rediscovering electricity and who may or may not have some connection to Caesar,” Ball said, referring to the Andy Serkis character from the previous trilogy.

Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes premiered in theaters on May 10, 2024, and earned $58.5 million in its opening weekend. The film went on to gross $170 million domestically and $394 million globally, according to Box Office Mojo, making it the second-highest-grossing launch in the film series.

How To Stream Kingdom Of The Planet Of The Apes

As of August 2, Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes is available to stream on Hulu. To watch the epic film and previous movies in the Planet of the Apes franchise, you’ll need to sign up for a Hulu subscription or a Disney+ subscription with the Hulu bundle.

The most affordable Hulu plan, including ads, costs $7.99 monthly and comes with a 30-day free trial. The Hulu (No Ads) plan is priced at $17.99 per month, and Hulu + Live TV is available for $76.99 per month with a three-day free trial.

The Disney Bundle Duo Basic is priced at $9.99 per month for Disney+ (With Ads) and Hulu (With Ads), while Disney Bundle Duo Premium is $19.99 per month for Disney+ (No Ads) and Hulu (No Ads).

Viewers can also purchase Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes for $19.99 on video-on-demand sites like Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV, and Fandango At Home. The film will be available to watch 4K Ultra HD, Blu-ray, and DVD on August 27, 2024.

How To Watch All The Planet of the Apes Movies In Order

Here’s how to watch the entire Planet of the Apes franchise, in order, from 1968’s Planet of the Apes to the 2024’s Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes.

Planet of the Apes (1968) — Watch on Hulu

Beneath the Planet of the Apes (1970) — Watch on Hulu

Escape from the Planet of the Apes (1971) — Watch on Hulu

Conquest of the Planet of the Apes (1972) — Watch on Hulu

Battle for the Planet of the Apes (1973) — Watch on Hulu

Planet of the Apes (2001) — Watch on Hulu

Rise of the Planet of the Apes (2011) — Watch on Hulu

Dawn of the Planet of the Apes (2014) — Watch on Hulu and Max

War for the Planet of the Apes (2017) — Watch on Hulu and Max

Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes (2024) — Watch on Hulu

Watch the official trailer for Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes below.
